 function _go(url, newWindow) {
 if (newWindow)
 window.open(url, '_blank');
 else
 document.location = url;
 }
 function $(id) { return document.getElementById(id); }
 var loadQueue = [];
 function runOnLoad(fn) { loadQueue.push(fn); }
 window.onload = function() {
 for (var i = 0; i < loadQueue.length; i++)
 loadQueue[i]();
 delete loadQueue;
 };

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }

                </span>

    <mr-cue centered="" cueprefname="search_for_numbers" hidden=""></mr-cue>
      
          
      
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>
      
      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

            Issue 1285885: Security: [ANGLE] Vulkan : Out-of-bounds memory can be accessed using bound offsets

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br><br>When processing the `glDrawArrays` method in the Vulkan renderer, `VertexArrayVk::updateStreamedAttribs` is called.<span class="line"><!---->When processing the `glDrawArrays` method in the Vulkan renderer, `VertexArrayVk::updateStreamedAttribs` is called.<!----></span><br><br>```c++<span class="line"><!---->```c++<!----></span><br>// Handle copying client attribs and/or expanding attrib buffer in case where attribute<span class="line"><!---->// Handle copying client attribs and/or expanding attrib buffer in case where attribute<!----></span><br>//  divisor value has to be emulated.<span class="line"><!---->//  divisor value has to be emulated.<!----></span><br>angle::Result VertexArrayVk::updateStreamedAttribs(const gl::Context *context,<span class="line"><!---->angle::Result VertexArrayVk::updateStreamedAttribs(const gl::Context *context,<!----></span><br>                                                   GLint firstVertex,<span class="line"><!---->                                                   GLint firstVertex,<!----></span><br>                                                   GLsizei vertexOrIndexCount,<span class="line"><!---->                                                   GLsizei vertexOrIndexCount,<!----></span><br>                                                   GLsizei instanceCount,<span class="line"><!---->                                                   GLsizei instanceCount,<!----></span><br>                                                   gl::DrawElementsType indexTypeOrInvalid,<span class="line"><!---->                                                   gl::DrawElementsType indexTypeOrInvalid,<!----></span><br>                                                   const void *indices)<span class="line"><!---->                                                   const void *indices)<!----></span><br>{<span class="line"><!---->{<!----></span><br>...<span class="line"><!---->...<!----></span><br>        // Emulated attrib<span class="line"><!---->        // Emulated attrib<!----></span><br>        BufferVk *bufferVk = nullptr;<span class="line"><!---->        BufferVk *bufferVk = nullptr;<!----></span><br>        if (binding.getBuffer().get() != nullptr)<span class="line"><!---->        if (binding.getBuffer().get() != nullptr)<!----></span><br>        {<span class="line"><!---->        {<!----></span><br>            // Map buffer to expand attribs for divisor emulation<span class="line"><!---->            // Map buffer to expand attribs for divisor emulation<!----></span><br>            bufferVk      = vk::GetImpl(binding.getBuffer().get());<span class="line"><!---->            bufferVk      = vk::GetImpl(binding.getBuffer().get());<!----></span><br>            void *buffSrc = nullptr;<span class="line"><!---->            void *buffSrc = nullptr;<!----></span><br>            ANGLE_TRY(bufferVk->mapImpl(contextVk, &buffSrc));<span class="line"><!---->            ANGLE_TRY(bufferVk-&gt;mapImpl(contextVk, &amp;buffSrc));<!----></span><br>            src = reinterpret_cast<const uint8_t *>(buffSrc) + binding.getOffset();                 // [1]<span class="line"><!---->            src = reinterpret_cast&lt;const uint8_t *&gt;(buffSrc) + binding.getOffset();                 // [1]<!----></span><br>        }<span class="line"><!---->        }<!----></span><br><br>        ANGLE_TRY(StreamVertexData(contextVk, &mDynamicVertexData, src, bytesToAllocate, 0,         // [2]<span class="line"><!---->        ANGLE_TRY(StreamVertexData(contextVk, &amp;mDynamicVertexData, src, bytesToAllocate, 0,         // [2]<!----></span><br>                                    instanceCount, binding.getStride(), stride,<span class="line"><!---->                                    instanceCount, binding.getStride(), stride,<!----></span><br>                                    vertexFormat.getVertexLoadFunction(compressed),<span class="line"><!---->                                    vertexFormat.getVertexLoadFunction(compressed),<!----></span><br>                                    &mCurrentArrayBuffers[attribIndex],<span class="line"><!---->                                    &amp;mCurrentArrayBuffers[attribIndex],<!----></span><br>                                    &mCurrentArrayBufferOffsets[attribIndex], divisor));<span class="line"><!---->                                    &amp;mCurrentArrayBufferOffsets[attribIndex], divisor));<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>When setting the source buffer pointer (`src`) in this method, the bound offset is used. [1]<span class="line"><!---->When setting the source buffer pointer (`src`) in this method, the bound offset is used. [1]<!----></span><br><br>This offset can be specified with the `glVertexAttribPointer` method.<span class="line"><!---->This offset can be specified with the `glVertexAttribPointer` method.<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>void gl.vertexAttribPointer(index, size, type, normalized, stride, offset);<span class="line"><!---->void gl.vertexAttribPointer(index, size, type, normalized, stride, offset);<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>Since there is no verification of this offset, it is possible to access memory outside the bounds.<span class="line"><!---->Since there is no verification of this offset, it is possible to access memory outside the bounds.<!----></span><br><br>This particular situation seems to arise when two programs are used (see poc.html).<span class="line"><!---->This particular situation seems to arise when two programs are used (see poc.html).<!----></span><br><br>The source pointer is used when copying memory and the following crash occurs. [2]<span class="line"><!---->The source pointer is used when copying memory and the following crash occurs. [2]<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>0:018> g<span class="line"><!---->0:018&gt; g<!----></span><br>(37d0.3110): Access violation - code c0000005 (first chance)<span class="line"><!---->(37d0.3110): Access violation - code c0000005 (first chance)<!----></span><br>First chance exceptions are reported before any exception handling.<span class="line"><!---->First chance exceptions are reported before any exception handling.<!----></span><br>This exception may be expected and handled.<span class="line"><!---->This exception may be expected and handled.<!----></span><br>rax=000001f495b66c10 rbx=0000000000000fff rcx=0000000000000000<span class="line"><!---->rax=000001f495b66c10 rbx=0000000000000fff rcx=0000000000000000<!----></span><br>rdx=0000000000000008 rsi=0000000000000008 rdi=00007ff973dc3d90<span class="line"><!---->rdx=0000000000000008 rsi=0000000000000008 rdi=00007ff973dc3d90<!----></span><br>rip=00007ff973dc3dab rsp=000000aab03fde38 rbp=0000000000001000<span class="line"><!---->rip=00007ff973dc3dab rsp=000000aab03fde38 rbp=0000000000001000<!----></span><br> r8=0000000000000001  r9=000001f49d2fc150 r10=000001f4a5c50290<span class="line"><!----> r8=0000000000000001  r9=000001f49d2fc150 r10=000001f4a5c50290<!----></span><br>r11=000001f4959ca0f8 r12=0000000000000001 r13=0000000000000001<span class="line"><!---->r11=000001f4959ca0f8 r12=0000000000000001 r13=0000000000000001<!----></span><br>r14=0000000000000000 r15=000001f4a5c50290<span class="line"><!---->r14=0000000000000000 r15=000001f4a5c50290<!----></span><br>iopl=0         nv up ei pl zr na po nc<span class="line"><!---->iopl=0         nv up ei pl zr na po nc<!----></span><br>cs=0033  ss=002b  ds=002b  es=002b  fs=0053  gs=002b             efl=00010246<span class="line"><!---->cs=0033  ss=002b  ds=002b  es=002b  fs=0053  gs=002b             efl=00010246<!----></span><br>libglesv2!rx::CopyNativeVertexData<unsigned char,1,1,0>+0x1b:<span class="line"><!---->libglesv2!rx::CopyNativeVertexData&lt;unsigned char,1,1,0&gt;+0x1b:<!----></span><br>00007ff9`73dc3dab 418a02          mov     al,byte ptr [r10] ds:000001f4`a5c50290=??<span           Comment 16<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1285885#c16">Comment 16<!----></a>

          
        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">

        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1285885#c16">Comment 16<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Fri, Jan 14, 2022, 5:34 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1285885#c16">Comment 16<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Fri, Jan 14, 2022, 5:34 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>

        Ok, so I think I understand this a bit better now - thanks for the info and the fix Jamie.<span class="line"><!---->Ok, so I think I understand this a bit better now - thanks for the info and the fix Jamie.<!----></span><br><br>These crash would be acceptable in a non-WebGL context as it's undefined behavior, but in a WebGL context robust buffer access handling is required, and it is normally enabled - the Vulkan backend isn't even normally used by ANGLE (D3D on Windows or GL on Mac/Linux). However, it does get used for the SwiftShader fallback and then we're hitting this code path and then ANGLE isn't behaving correctly in a couple of spots where special handling is required and it would crash instead of doing what robust buffer access rules require (out-of-bound reads returning values from anywhere within the buffer object, or 0 or 1 etc). So the fix would be to follow those rules in the ANGLE Vulkan backend (when in the WebGL context), by making sure StreamVertexData calls only make reads within the buffer (however it is given a raw pointer so at least some of validation would have to happen at the call sites).<span class="line"><!---->These crash would be acceptable in a non-WebGL context as it's undefined behavior, but in a WebGL context robust buffer access handling is required, and it is normally enabled - the Vulkan backend isn't even normally used by ANGLE (D3D on Windows or GL on Mac/Linux). However, it does get used for the SwiftShader fallback and then we're hitting this code path and then ANGLE isn't behaving correctly in a couple of spots where special handling is required and it would crash instead of doing what robust buffer access rules require (out-of-bound reads returning values from anywhere within the buffer object, or 0 or 1 etc). So the fix would be to follow those rules in the ANGLE Vulkan backend (when in the WebGL context), by making sure StreamVertexData calls only make reads within the buffer (however it is given a raw pointer so at least some of validation would have to happen at the call sites).<!----></span><br><br>I reproduced this with an ANGLE end2end test by invoking calls similarly to what poc.html does.<span class="line"><!---->I reproduced this with an ANGLE end2end test by invoking calls similarly to what poc.html does.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>
    
      
    <mr-comment headinglevel="2"></mr-comment>
      
      
      
        
          Comment 17<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1285885#c17">Comment 17<!----></a>

          
        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">

        Requesting merge to extended stable M96 because latest trunk commit (963146) appears to be after extended stable branch point (929512).<span class="line"><!---->Requesting merge to extended stable M96 because latest trunk commit (963146) appears to be after extended stable branch point (929512).<!----></span><br><br>Requesting merge to stable M97 because latest trunk commit (963146) appears to be after stable branch point (938553).<span class="line"><!---->Requesting merge to stable M97 because latest trunk commit (963146) appears to be after stable branch point (938553).<!----></span><br><br>Requesting merge to beta M98 because latest trunk commit (963146) appears to be after beta branch point (950365).<span class="line"><!---->Requesting merge to beta M98 because latest trunk commit (963146) appears to be after beta branch point (950365).<!----></span><br><br>Requesting merge to dev M99 because latest trunk commit (963146) appears to be after dev branch point (961656).<span class="line"><!---->Requesting merge to dev M99 because latest trunk commit (963146) appears to be after dev branch point (961656).<!----></span><br><br>For more details visit <span class="line"><!---->For more details visit <!----></span>https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage"><!---->https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<!----></a> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<span class="line"><!----> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        merge-na for M96 and M97 as M98 is now stable channel<span class="line"><!---->merge-na for M96 and M97 as M98 is now stable channel<!----></span><br><br>romanl@ please respond to the merge questionnaire (it's not necessary to do so in full since this is not at all related to a new feature and there is clearly a single CL for merge), but it would be helpful if you could verify this has been tested and verified locally or on Canary. Since this change is rather sizable and textually large, it would be helpful if you could verify there's not stability issues or other concerns before I review this for merge to M99 and M98. Thank you!<span class="line"><!---->romanl@ please respond to the merge questionnaire (it's not necessary to do so in full since this is not at all related to a new feature and there is clearly a single CL for merge), but it would be helpful if you could verify this has been tested and verified locally or on Canary.         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Congratulations, the VRP Panel has decided to award you $7,000 for this report. This is a bit higher on average for a VRP reward for an OOB read; however, this was in memory access was in the GPU process, which we are wanting to incentivize the reporting of security bugs in, so this was judged under the criteria of baseline memory corruption in the GPU process and falls under the new reward amounts for GPU and other bugs in highly privileged processes (g.co/chrome/vrp). Thank you for your report and nice work!<span class="line"><!---->Congratulations, the VRP Panel has decided to award you $7,000 for this report. This is a bit higher on average for a VRP reward for an OOB read; however, this was in memory access was in the GPU process, which we are wanting to incentivize the reporting of security bugs in, so this was judged under the criteria of baseline memory corruption in the GPU process and falls under the new reward amounts for GPU and other bugs in highly privileged processes (g.co/chrome/vrp). Thank you for your report and nice work!<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>

        Hi Roman, thanks for the feedback about timelines. The timing with the later CL was a little late/tight for the forthcoming stable respin (RC cut happening today) and we needed to ensure there was sufficient time on Canary before approving the merge. Please let me know what type of lead time I need to request merges on before cut deadlines so I can better partner with your team from a security perspective. <span class="line"><!---->Hi Roman, thanks for the feedback about timelines. The timing with the later CL was a little late/tight for the forthcoming stable respin (RC cut happening today) and we needed to ensure there was sufficient time on Canary before approving the merge. Please let me know what type of lead time I need to request merges on before cut deadlines so I can better partner with your team from a security perspective. <!----></span><br><br>>>> What does this entail? I just checked that the original issue reproduces on stable Chrome on a windows cloudtop, and doesn't reproduce on canary. How do I know if this might have caused "stability issues" ?<span class="line"><!---->&gt;&gt;&gt; What does this entail? I just checked that the original issue reproduces on stable Chrome on a windows cloudtop, and doesn't reproduce on canary. How do I know if this might have caused "stability issues" ?<!----></span><br><br>Checking that no stability issues means checking that there were was not a sufficient amount of crashes introduced from the fix commit. There is a many dashboards and data against which to provide stability checks, but I am not the authoritative voice of stability processes or stability sheriffing and don't want to overstep, so I would check with the Release team<span class="line"><!---->Checking that no stability issues means checking that there were was not a sufficient amount of crashes introduced from the fix commit.            issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

            <div>
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          <div class="input-grid">

         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.

           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement.

          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>
      <mr-click-throughs></mr-click-throughs>

              <mr-issue-details class="main-item"><!---->

    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }
      <style>
        
  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */

    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;

    margin: 0;

    line-height: 1.6;
  }

    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;

    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->s<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->star the current issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->?<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->show this help dialog<!----></span>
              <!---->
            </div>
          <!---->
        </div>
        
          Note: Only signed in users can star issues or add comments, and
          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.
        <p>
          Note: Only signed in users can star issues or add comments, and
          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.
        </p>
      <chops-dialog>
        <h2>
          Issue tracker keyboard shortcuts
          <button class="close-button">
            Close
          </button>
        </h2>
        <div class="keyboard-help">
          <!---->
            <div class="keyboard-help-section">
              <span></span><span class="help-title"><!---->Issue list<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->k<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->j<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->up/down in the list<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->o<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->Enter<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->open the current issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->Shift-O<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->open issue in new tab<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->x<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->select the current issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
            </div>
          <!---->
            <div class="keyboard-help-section">
              <span></span><span class="help-title"><!---->Issue details<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->k<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->j<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->prev/next issue in list<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->u<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->up to issue list<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->r<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->reply to current issue<!----></span>

                    <kbd><!---->Ctrl+Enter<!----></kbd>

                  <!---->:

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>

          Note:<b>Note:</b>
          Clock icons indicate that users may not be available.
          Tooltips show the reason.

        Description #1 by n...@nesk.kr (Jan 10, 2022)
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by n...@nesk.kr (Jan 10, 2022)
      </option>
    
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">
          <!---->
      <option value="0" selected="">

        </select>
      <div class="select-container">
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">

      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by n...@nesk.kr (Jan 10, 2022)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br><br>When processing the `glDrawArrays` method in the Vulkan renderer, `VertexArrayVk::updateStreamedAttribs` is called.<span class="line"><!---->When processing the `glDrawArrays` method in the Vulkan renderer, `VertexArrayVk::updateStreamedAttribs` is called.<!----></span><br><br>```c++<span class="line"><!---->```c++<!----></span><br>// Handle copying client attribs and/or expanding attrib buffer in case where attribute<span class="line"><!---->// Handle copying client attribs and/or expanding attrib buffer in case where attribute<!----></span><br>//  divisor value has to be emulated.<span class="line"><!---->//  divisor value has to be emulated.<!----></span><br>angle::Result                        instanceCount, binding.getStride(), stride,<span class="line"><!---->                                    instanceCount, binding.getStride(), stride,<!----></span><br>                       &mCurrentArrayBufferOffsets[attribIndex], divisor));<span class="line"><!---->                                    &amp;mCurrentArrayBufferOffsets[attribIndex], divisor));<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>When setting the source buffer pointer (`src`) in this method, the bound offset is used. [1]<span class="line"><!---->When setting the source buffer pointer (`src`) in this method, the bound offset is used. [1]<!----></span><br><br>This offset can be specified with the `glVertexAttribPointer` method.<span class="line"><!---->This offset can be specified with the `glVertexAttribPointer` method.<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>void gl.vertexAttribPointer(index, size, type, normalized, stride, offset);<span class="line"><!---->void gl.vertexAttribPointer(index, size, type, normalized, stride, offset);<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>Since there is no verification of this offset, it is possible to access memory outside the bounds.<span class="line"><!---->Since there is no verification of this offset, it is possible to access memory outside the bounds.<!----></span><br><br>This particular situation seems to arise when two programs are used (see poc.html).<span class="line"><!---->This particular situation seems to arise when two programs are used (see poc.html).<!----></span><br><br>The source pointer is used when copying memory and the following crash occurs. [2]<span class="line"><!---->The source pointer is used when copying memory and the following crash occurs.         by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">

        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1285885#c16">Comment 16<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Fri, Jan 14, 2022, 5:34 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1285885#c16">Comment 16<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Fri, Jan 14, 2022, 5:34 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>

        Ok, so I think I understand this a bit better now - thanks for the info and the fix Jamie.<span class="line"><!---->Ok, so I think I understand this a bit better now - thanks for the info and the fix Jamie.<!----></span><br><br>These crash would be acceptable in a non-WebGL context as it's undefined behavior, but in a WebGL context robust buffer access handling is required, and it is normally enabled - the Vulkan backend isn't even normally used by ANGLE (D3D on Windows or GL on Mac/Linux). However, it does get used for the SwiftShader fallback and then we're hitting this code path and then ANGLE isn't behaving correctly in a couple of spots where special handling is required and it would crash instead of doing what robust buffer access rules require (out-of-bound reads returning values from anywhere within the buffer object, or 0 or 1 etc). So the fix would be to follow those rules in the ANGLE Vulkan backend (when in the WebGL context), by making sure StreamVertexData calls only make reads within the buffer (however it is given a raw pointer so at least some of validation would have to happen at the call sites).<span class="line"><!---->These crash would be acceptable in a non-WebGL context as it's undefined behavior, but in a WebGL context robust buffer access handling is required, and it is normally enabled - the Vulkan backend isn't even normally used by ANGLE (D3D on Windows or GL on Mac/Linux). However, it does get used for the SwiftShader fallback and then we're hitting this code path and then ANGLE isn't behaving correctly in a couple of spots where special handling is required and it would crash instead of doing what robust buffer access rules require (out-of-bound reads returning values from anywhere within the buffer object, or 0 or 1 etc). So the fix would be to follow those rules in the ANGLE Vulkan backend (when in the WebGL context), by making sure StreamVertexData calls only make reads within the buffer (however it is given a raw pointer so at least some of validation would have to happen at the call sites).<!----></span><br><br>I reproduced this with an ANGLE end2end test by invoking calls similarly to what poc.html does.<span class="line"><!---->I reproduced this with an ANGLE end2end test by invoking calls similarly to what poc.html does.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

        The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/angle/angle/+/5f0badf4541ba52659c937cfe9190d3735a76c10<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/angle/angle/+/5f0badf4541ba52659c937cfe9190d3735a76c10"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/angle/angle/+/5f0badf4541ba52659c937cfe9190d3735a76c10<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>5f0badf4541ba52659c937cfe9190d3735a76c10<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/5f0badf4541ba52659c937cfe9190d3735a76c10"><!---->5f0badf4541ba52659c937cfe9190d3735a76c10<!----></a><br>Author: Roman Lavrov <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Roman Lavrov &lt;<!----></span>romanl@google.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/romanl@google.com"><!---->romanl@google.com<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Tue Jan 18 20:05:55 2022<span class="line"><!---->Date: Tue Jan 18 20:05:55 2022<!----></span><br><br>Vulkan: Prevent out of bounds read in divisor emulation path.<span class="line"><!---->Vulkan: Prevent out of bounds read in divisor emulation path.<!----></span><br><br>Split the replicated part of StreamVertexData out to<span class="line"><!---->Split the replicated part of StreamVertexData out to<!----></span><br>StreamVertexDataWithDivisor, there is only a partial argument<span class="line"><!---->StreamVertexDataWithDivisor, there is only a partial argument<!----></span><br>overlap between the two.<span class="line"><!---->overlap between the two.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: chromium:1285885<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1285885"         romanl: Uh oh! This issue still open and hasn't been updated in the last 15 days. This is a serious vulnerability, and we want to ensure that there's progress. Could you please leave an update with the current status and any potential blockers?<span class="line"><!---->romanl: Uh oh! This issue still open and hasn't been updated in the last 15 days.         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Congratulations, the VRP Panel has decided to award you $7,000 for this report. This is a bit higher on average for a VRP reward for an OOB read; however, this was in memory access was in the GPU process, which we are wanting to incentivize the reporting of security bugs in, so this was judged under the criteria of baseline memory corruption in the GPU process and falls under the new reward amounts for GPU and other bugs in highly privileged processes (g.co/chrome/vrp). Thank you for your report and nice work!<span class="line"><!---->Congratulations, the VRP Panel has decided to award you $7,000 for this report. This is a bit higher on average for a VRP reward for an OOB read; however, this was in memory access was in the GPU process, which we are wanting to incentivize the reporting of security bugs in, so this was judged under the criteria of baseline memory corruption in the GPU process and falls under the new reward amounts for GPU and other bugs in highly privileged processes (g.co/chrome/vrp). Thank you for your report and nice work!<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Hi Roman, thanks for the feedback about timelines. The timing with the later CL was a little late/tight for the forthcoming stable respin (RC cut happening today) and we needed to ensure there was sufficient time on Canary before approving the merge. Please let me know what type of lead time I need to request merges on before cut deadlines so I can better partner with your team from a security perspective. <span class="line"><!---->Hi Roman, thanks for the feedback about timelines. The timing with the later CL was a little late/tight for the forthcoming stable respin (RC cut happening today) and we needed to ensure there was sufficient time on Canary before approving the merge. Please let me know what type of lead time I need to request merges on before cut deadlines so I can better partner with your team from a security perspective. <!----></span><br><br>>>> What does this entail? I just checked that the original issue reproduces on stable Chrome on a windows cloudtop, and doesn't reproduce on canary. How do I know if this might have caused "stability issues" ?<span class="line"><!---->&gt;&gt;&gt; What does this entail? I just checked that the original issue reproduces on stable Chrome on a windows cloudtop, and doesn't reproduce on canary. How do I know if this might have caused "stability issues" ?<!----></span><br><br>Checking that no stability issues means checking that there were was not a sufficient amount of crashes introduced from the fix commit. There is a many dashboards and data against which to provide stability checks, but I am not the authoritative voice of stability processes or stability sheriffing and don't want to overstep, so I would check with the Release team<span class="line"><!---->Checking that no stability issues means checking that there were was not a sufficient amount of crashes introduced from the fix commit. There is a many dashboards and data against which to provide stability checks, but I am not the authoritative voice of stability processes or stability sheriffing and don't want to overstep, so I would check with the Release team<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>go/chrome-sheriffing<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://go/chrome-sheriffing"><!---->go/chrome-sheriffing<!----></a>.<span class="line"><!---->.<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span><br>What I can convey is one of the first places I start is checking the commit against the chromium dashboard >commits with <span class="line"><!---->What I can convey is one of the first places I start is checking the commit against the chromium dashboard &gt;commits with <!----></span>https://chromiumdash.appspot.com/commit/79d1d335f7adaa4cedcd333b30395648d525a1ff<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromiumdash.appspot.com/commit/79d1d335f7adaa4cedcd333b30395648d525a1ff"><!---->https://chromiumdash.appspot.com/commit/79d1d335f7adaa4cedcd333b30395648d525a1ff<!----></a> that provides relevant links to stability metrics from the chrome crash logs for the instance of canary and dev your commit landed on.<span class="line"><!----> that provides relevant links to stability metrics from the chrome crash logs for the instance of canary and dev your commit landed on.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          flex-flow: column;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          align-items: stretch;
        }
        mr-launch-overview[hidden] {
          display: none;
        }
        mr-phase {
          margin-bottom: 0.75em;
        }
      </style>
      
      
    <!----></mr-launch-overview>
            </div>
          </div>
        </div>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

        for LitElement.

      <style>
        mr-issue-page {

        }

 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }

 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });

      <style>

    display: inline;

    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
