  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }
      </style>

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;

    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }

          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }
      </style>
      
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      
      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>

          </button>

    <mr-cue centered="" cueprefname="search_for_numbers" hidden=""></mr-cue>
      
          
      
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br><br>When processing the `glDrawArrays` method in the Vulkan renderer, `VertexArrayVk::updateStreamedAttribs` is called.<span class="line"><!---->When processing the `glDrawArrays` method in the Vulkan renderer, `VertexArrayVk::updateStreamedAttribs` is called.<!----></span><br><br>```c++<span class="line"><!---->```c++<!----></span><br>// Handle copying client attribs and/or expanding attrib buffer in case where attribute<span class="line"><!---->// Handle copying client attribs and/or expanding attrib buffer in case where attribute<!----></span><br>//  divisor value has to be emulated.<span class="line"><!---->//  divisor value has to be emulated.<!----></span><br>angle::Result VertexArrayVk::updateStreamedAttribs(const gl::Context *context,<span class="line"><!---->angle::Result VertexArrayVk::updateStreamedAttribs(const gl::Context *context,<!----></span><br>                                                   GLint firstVertex,<span class="line"><!---->                                                   GLint firstVertex,<!----></span><br>                                                   GLsizei vertexOrIndexCount,<span class="line"><!---->                                                   GLsizei vertexOrIndexCount,<!----></span><br>                                                   GLsizei instanceCount,<span class="line"><!---->                                                   GLsizei instanceCount,<!----></span><br>                                                   gl::DrawElementsType indexTypeOrInvalid,<span class="line"><!---->                                                   gl::DrawElementsType indexTypeOrInvalid,<!----></span><br>                                                   const void *indices)<span class="line"><!---->                                                   const void *indices)<!----></span><br>{<span class="line"><!---->{<!----></span><br>...<span class="line"><!---->...<!----></span><br>        // Emulated attrib<span class="line"><!---->        // Emulated attrib<!----></span><br>        BufferVk *bufferVk = nullptr;<span class="line"><!---->        BufferVk *bufferVk = nullptr;<!----></span><br>        if (binding.getBuffer().get() != nullptr)<span class="line"><!---->        if (binding.getBuffer().get() != nullptr)<!----></span><br>        {<span class="line"><!---->        {<!----></span><br>            // Map buffer to expand attribs for divisor emulation<span class="line"><!---->            // Map buffer to expand attribs for divisor emulation<!----></span><br>            bufferVk      = vk::GetImpl(binding.getBuffer().get());<span class="line"><!---->            bufferVk      = vk::GetImpl(binding.getBuffer().get());<!----></span><br>            void *buffSrc = nullptr;<span class="line"><!---->            void *buffSrc = nullptr;<!----></span><br>            ANGLE_TRY(bufferVk->mapImpl(contextVk, &buffSrc));<span class="line"><!---->            ANGLE_TRY(bufferVk-&gt;mapImpl(contextVk, &amp;buffSrc));<!----></span><br>            src = reinterpret_cast<const uint8_t *>(buffSrc) + binding.getOffset();                 // [1]<span class="line"><!---->            src = reinterpret_cast&lt;const uint8_t *&gt;(buffSrc) + binding.getOffset();                 // [1]<!----></span><br>        }<span class="line"><!---->        }<!----></span><br><br>        ANGLE_TRY(StreamVertexData(contextVk, &mDynamicVertexData, src, bytesToAllocate, 0,         // [2]<span class="line"><!---->        ANGLE_TRY(StreamVertexData(contextVk, &amp;mDynamicVertexData, src, bytesToAllocate, 0,         // [2]<!----></span><br>                                    instanceCount, binding.getStride(), stride,<span class="line"><!---->                                    instanceCount, binding.getStride(), stride,<!----></span><br>                                    vertexFormat.getVertexLoadFunction(compressed),<span class="line"><!---->                                    vertexFormat.getVertexLoadFunction(compressed),<!----></span><br>                                    &mCurrentArrayBuffers[attribIndex],<span class="line"><!---->                                    &amp;mCurrentArrayBuffers[attribIndex],<!----></span><br>                                    &mCurrentArrayBufferOffsets[attribIndex], divisor));<span class="line"><!---->                                    &amp;mCurrentArrayBufferOffsets[attribIndex], divisor));<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>When setting the source buffer pointer (`src`) in this method, the bound offset is used. [1]<span class="line"><!---->When setting the source buffer pointer (`src`) in this method, the bound offset is used. [1]<!----></span><br><br>This offset can be specified with the `glVertexAttribPointer` method.<span class="line"><!---->This offset can be specified with the `glVertexAttribPointer` method.<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>void gl.vertexAttribPointer(index, size, type, normalized, stride, offset);<span class="line"><!---->void gl.vertexAttribPointer(index, size, type, normalized, stride, offset);<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>Since there is no verification of this offset, it is possible to access memory outside the bounds.<span class="line"><!---->Since there is no verification of this offset, it is possible to access memory outside the bounds.<!----></span><br><br>This particular situation seems to arise when two programs are used (see poc.html).<span class="line"><!---->This particular situation seems to arise when two programs are used (see poc.html).<!----></span><br><br>The source pointer is used when copying memory and the following crash occurs. [2]<span class="line"><!---->The source pointer is used when copying memory and the following crash occurs. [2]<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>0:018> g<span class="line"><!---->0:018&gt; g<!----></span><br>(37d0.3110): Access violation - code c0000005 (first chance)<span class="line"><!---->(37d0.3110): Access violation - code c0000005 (first chance)<!----></span><br>First chance exceptions are reported before any exception handling.<span class="line"><!---->First chance exceptions are reported before any exception handling.<!----></span><br>This exception may be expected and handled.<span class="line"><!---->This exception may be expected and handled.<!----></span><br>rax=000001f495b66c10 rbx=0000000000000fff rcx=0000000000000000<span class="line"><!---->rax=000001f495b66c10 rbx=0000000000000fff rcx=0000000000000000<!----></span><br>rdx=0000000000000008 rsi=0000000000000008 rdi=00007ff973dc3d90<span class="line"><!---->rdx=0000000000000008 rsi=0000000000000008 rdi=00007ff973dc3d90<!----></span><br>rip=00007ff973dc3dab rsp=000000aab03fde38 rbp=0000000000001000<span class="line"><!---->rip=00007ff973dc3dab rsp=000000aab03fde38 rbp=0000000000001000<!----></span><br> r8=0000000000000001  r9=000001f49d2fc150 r10=000001f4a5c50290<span class="line"><!----> r8=0000000000000001  r9=000001f49d2fc150         by

        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1285885#c16">Comment 16<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>

      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1285885#c16">Comment 16<!----></a>

          
        by

        Ok, so I think I understand this a bit better now - thanks for the info and the fix Jamie.<span class="line"><!---->Ok, so I think I understand this a bit better now - thanks for the info and the fix Jamie.<!----></span><br><br>These crash would be acceptable in a non-WebGL context as it's undefined behavior, but in a WebGL context robust buffer access handling is required, and it is normally enabled - the Vulkan backend isn't even normally used by ANGLE (D3D on Windows or GL on Mac/Linux). However, it does get used for the SwiftShader fallback and then we're hitting this code path and then ANGLE isn't behaving correctly in a couple of spots where special handling is required and it would crash instead of doing what robust buffer access rules require (out-of-bound reads returning values from anywhere within the buffer object, or 0 or 1 etc). So the fix would be to follow those rules in the ANGLE Vulkan backend (when in the WebGL context), by making sure StreamVertexData calls only make reads within the buffer (however it is given a raw pointer so at least some of validation would have to happen at the call sites).<span class="line"><!---->These crash would be acceptable in a non-WebGL context as it's undefined behavior, but in a WebGL context robust buffer access handling is required, and it is normally enabled - the Vulkan backend isn't even normally used by ANGLE (D3D on Windows or GL on Mac/Linux). However, it does get used for the SwiftShader fallback and then we're hitting this code path and then ANGLE isn't behaving correctly in a couple of spots where special handling is required and it would crash instead of doing what robust buffer access rules require (out-of-bound reads returning values from anywhere within the buffer object, or 0 or 1 etc). So the fix would be to follow those rules in the ANGLE Vulkan backend (when in the WebGL context), by making sure StreamVertexData calls only make reads within the buffer (however it is given a raw pointer so at least some of validation would have to happen at the call sites).<!----></span><br><br>I reproduced this with an ANGLE end2end test by invoking calls similarly to what poc.html does.<span class="line"><!---->I reproduced this with an ANGLE end2end test by invoking calls similarly to what poc.html does.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>

If so, please describe required testing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact the milestone owner if you have questions.<span class="line"><!---->Please contact the milestone owner if you have questions.<!----></span><br>Owners: govind (Android), harrysouders (iOS), dgagnon (ChromeOS), srinivassista (Desktop)<span class="line"><!---->Owners: govind (Android), harrysouders (iOS), dgagnon (ChromeOS), srinivassista (Desktop)<!----></span><br><br>For more details visit <span class="line"><!---->For more details visit <!----></span>https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage"><!---->https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<!----></a> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<span class="line"><!----> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Congratulations, the VRP Panel has decided to award you $7,000 for this report. This is a bit higher on average for a VRP reward for an OOB read; however, this was in memory access was in the GPU process, which we are wanting to incentivize the reporting of security bugs in, so this was judged under the criteria of baseline memory corruption in the GPU process and falls under the new reward amounts for GPU and other bugs in highly privileged processes (g.co/chrome/vrp). Thank you for your report and nice work!<span class="line"><!---->Congratulations, the VRP Panel has decided to award you $7,000 for this report. This is a bit higher on average for a VRP reward for an OOB read; however, this was in memory access was in the GPU process, which we are wanting to incentivize the reporting of security bugs in, so this was judged under the criteria of baseline memory corruption in the GPU process and falls under the new reward amounts for GPU and other bugs in highly privileged processes (g.co/chrome/vrp). Thank you for your report and nice work!<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Hi Roman, thanks for the feedback about timelines. The timing with the later CL was a little late/tight for the forthcoming stable respin (RC cut happening today) and we needed to ensure there was sufficient time on Canary before approving the merge. Please let me know what type of lead time I need to request merges on before cut deadlines so I can better partner with your team from a security perspective. <span class="line"><!---->Hi Roman, thanks for the feedback about timelines. The timing with the later CL was a little late/tight for the forthcoming stable respin (RC cut happening today) and we needed to ensure there was sufficient time on Canary before approving the merge. Please let me know what type of lead time I need to request merges on before cut deadlines so I can better partner with your team from a security perspective. <!----></span><br><br>>>> What does this entail? I just checked that the original issue reproduces on stable Chrome on a windows cloudtop, and doesn't reproduce on canary. How do I know if this might have caused "stability issues" ?<span class="line"><!---->&gt;&gt;&gt; What does this entail? I just checked that the original issue reproduces on stable Chrome on a windows cloudtop, and doesn't reproduce on canary. How do I know if this might have caused "stability issues" ?<!----></span><br><br>Checking that no stability issues means checking that there were was not a sufficient amount of crashes introduced from the fix commit. There is a many dashboards and data against which to provide stability checks, but I am not the authoritative voice of stability processes or stability sheriffing and don't want to overstep, so I would check with the Release team<span class="line"><!---->Checking that no stability issues means checking that there were was not a sufficient amount of crashes introduced from the fix commit.            issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      
        
          
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        
          
            
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>

        mr-issue-page {

    <mr-app loginurl="https://accounts.google.com/AccountChooser?continue=https%3A%2F%2Fuc.appengine.google.com%2F_ah%2Fconflogin%3Fcontinue%3Dhttps%253A%252F%252Fbugs.chromium.org%252Fp%252Fchromium%252Fissues%252Fdetail%253Fid%253D1285885%2526q%253Dlabel%25253Aexternal_security_report%2526can%253D1%2526start%253D3200" logouturl="https://bugs.chromium.org/_ah/logout?continue=https://accounts.google.com/Logout%3Fcontinue%3Dhttps://uc.appengine.google.com/_ah/logout%253Fcontinue%253Dhttps://www.google.com/url%25253Fsa%25253DD%252526q%25253Dhttps://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail%2525253Fid%2525253D1285885%25252526q%2525253Dlabel%252525253Aexternal_security_report%25252526can%2525253D1%25252526start%2525253D3200%252526ust%25253D1703407630594933%252526usg%25253DAOvVaw2b25W1mNh09vXZr6x_nev7%26service%3Dah" versionbase="https://61906-5c6a57f-dot-monorail-prod.appspot.com" projectalert=""><!---->
      <style>
        
  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }
      </style>

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;

                    <kbd><!---->Ctrl+Enter<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator"> / </span>

                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->save issue reply (submit issue on issue filing page)<!----></span>
              <!---->
            </div>

          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

            Issue 1285885: Security: [ANGLE] Vulkan : Out-of-bounds memory can be accessed using bound offsets
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1285885: Security: [ANGLE] Vulkan : Out-of-bounds memory can be accessed using bound offsets
          </h1>
          
            Reported by
            
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>
      n...@nesk.kr<a id="user-link" href="/u/1139447227" title="n...@nesk.kr"><!---->n...@nesk.kr<!----></a>
      n...@nesk.kr<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->n...@nesk.kr<!----></span>

          <h1>
            
            Issue 1285885: Security: [ANGLE] Vulkan : Out-of-bounds memory can be accessed using bound offsets
          </h1>
          <small class="byline">
            Reported by
            <mr-user-link aria-label="issue reporter"></mr-user-link>
            on <chops-timestamp title="Mon, Jan 10, 2022, 11:41 AM EST"></chops-timestamp>
            
          </small>
        </div>
      <div class="main-text-outer">
        <div class="main-text">
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1285885: Security: [ANGLE] Vulkan : Out-of-bounds memory can be accessed using bound offsets
          </h1>
          <small class="byline">
            Reported by
            <mr-user-link aria-label="issue reporter"></mr-user-link>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br><br>When processing the `glDrawArrays` method in the Vulkan renderer, `VertexArrayVk::updateStreamedAttribs` is called.<span class="line"><!---->When processing the `glDrawArrays` method in the Vulkan renderer, `VertexArrayVk::updateStreamedAttribs` is called.<!----></span><br><br>```c++<span class="line"><!---->```c++<!----></span><br>// Handle copying client attribs and/or expanding attrib buffer in case where attribute<span class="line"><!---->// Handle copying client attribs and/or expanding attrib buffer in case where attribute<!----></span><br>//  divisor value has to be emulated.<span class="line"><!---->//  divisor value has to be emulated.<!----></span><br>angle::Result VertexArrayVk::updateStreamedAttribs(const gl::Context *context,<span class="line"><!---->angle::Result VertexArrayVk::updateStreamedAttribs(const gl::Context *context,<!----></span><br>                                                   GLint firstVertex,<span class="line"><!---->                                                   GLint firstVertex,<!----></span><br>                                                   GLsizei vertexOrIndexCount,<span class="line"><!---->                                                   GLsizei vertexOrIndexCount,<!----></span><br>                                                   GLsizei instanceCount,<span class="line"><!---->                                                   GLsizei instanceCount,<!----></span><br>                                                   gl::DrawElementsType indexTypeOrInvalid,<span class="line"><!---->                                                   gl::DrawElementsType indexTypeOrInvalid,<!----></span><br>                                                   const void *indices)<span class="line"><!---->                                                   const void *indices)<!----></span><br>{<span class="line"><!---->{<!----></span><br>...<span class="line"><!---->...<!----></span><br>        // Emulated attrib<span class="line"><!---->        // Emulated attrib<!----></span><br>        BufferVk *bufferVk = nullptr;<span class="line"><!---->        BufferVk *bufferVk = nullptr;<!----></span><br>        if (binding.getBuffer().get() != nullptr)<span class="line"><!---->        if (binding.getBuffer().get() != nullptr)<!----></span><br>        {<span class="line"><!---->        {<!----></span><br>            // Map buffer to expand attribs for divisor emulation<span class="line"><!---->            // Map buffer to expand attribs for divisor emulation<!----></span><br>            bufferVk      = vk::GetImpl(binding.getBuffer().get());<span class="line"><!---->            bufferVk      = vk::GetImpl(binding.getBuffer().get());<!----></span><br>            void *buffSrc = nullptr;<span class="line"><!---->            void *buffSrc = nullptr;<!----></span><br>            ANGLE_TRY(bufferVk->mapImpl(contextVk, &buffSrc));<span class="line"><!---->            ANGLE_TRY(bufferVk-&gt;mapImpl(contextVk, &amp;buffSrc));<!----></span><br>            src = reinterpret_cast<const uint8_t *>(buffSrc) + binding.getOffset();                 // [1]<span class="line"><!---->            src = reinterpret_cast&lt;const uint8_t *&gt;(buffSrc) + binding.getOffset();                 // [1]<!----></span><br>        }<span class="line"><!---->        }<!----></span><br><br>        ANGLE_TRY(StreamVertexData(contextVk, &mDynamicVertexData, src, bytesToAllocate, 0,         // [2]<span class="line"><!---->        ANGLE_TRY(StreamVertexData(contextVk, &amp;mDynamicVertexData, src, bytesToAllocate, 0,         // [2]<!----></span><br>                                    instanceCount, binding.getStride(), stride,<span class="line"><!---->                                    instanceCount, binding.getStride(), stride,<!----></span><br>                                    vertexFormat.getVertexLoadFunction(compressed),<span class="line"><!---->                                    vertexFormat.getVertexLoadFunction(compressed),<!----></span><br>                                    &mCurrentArrayBuffers[attribIndex],<span class="line"><!---->                                    &amp;mCurrentArrayBuffers[attribIndex],<!----></span><br>                                    &mCurrentArrayBufferOffsets[attribIndex], divisor));<span class="line"><!---->                                    &amp;mCurrentArrayBufferOffsets[attribIndex], divisor));<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>When setting the source buffer pointer (`src`) in this method, the bound offset is used. [1]<span class="line"><!---->When setting the source buffer pointer (`src`) in this method, the bound offset is used. [1]<!----></span><br><br>This offset can be specified with the `glVertexAttribPointer` method.<span class="line"><!---->This offset can be specified with the `glVertexAttribPointer` method.<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>void gl.vertexAttribPointer(index, size, type, normalized, stride, offset);<span class="line"><!---->void gl.vertexAttribPointer(index, size, type, normalized, stride, offset);<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>Since there is no verification of this offset, it is possible to access memory outside the bounds.<span class="line"><!---->Since there is no verification of this offset, it is possible to access memory outside the bounds.<!----></span><br><br>This particular situation seems to arise when two programs are used (see poc.html).<span class="line"><!---->This particular situation seems to arise when two programs are used (see poc.html).<!----></span><br><br>The source pointer is used when copying memory and the following crash occurs. [2]<span class="line"><!---->The source pointer is used when copying memory and the following crash occurs. [2]<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>0:018> g<span class="line"><!---->0:018&gt; g<!----></span><br>(37d0.3110): Access violation - code c0000005 (first chance)<span class="line"><!---->(37d0.3110): Access violation - code c0000005 (first chance)<!----></span><br>First chance exceptions are reported before any exception handling.<span class="line"><!---->First chance exceptions are reported before any exception handling.<!----></span><br>This exception may be expected and handled.<span class="line"><!---->This exception may be expected and handled.<!----></span><br>rax=000001f495b66c10 rbx=0000000000000fff rcx=0000000000000000<span class="line"><!---->rax=000001f495b66c10 rbx=0000000000000fff rcx=0000000000000000<!----></span><br>rdx=0000000000000008 rsi=0000000000000008 rdi=00007ff973dc3d90<span class="line"><!---->rdx=0000000000000008 rsi=0000000000000008 rdi=00007ff973dc3d90<!----></span><br>rip=00007ff973dc3dab rsp=000000aab03fde38 rbp=0000000000001000<span class="line"><!---->rip=00007ff973dc3dab rsp=000000aab03fde38 rbp=0000000000001000<!----></span><br> r8=0000000000000001  r9=000001f49d2fc150 r10=000001f4a5c50290<span class="line"><!----> r8=0000000000000001  r9=000001f49d2fc150 r10=000001f4a5c50290<!----></span><br>r11=000001f4959ca0f8 r12=0000000000000001 r13=0000000000000001<span class="line"><!---->r11=000001f4959ca0f8 r12=0000000000000001 r13=0000000000000001<!----></span><br>r14=0000000000000000 r15=000001f4a5c50290<span class="line"><!---->r14=0000000000000000 r15=000001f4a5c50290<!----></span><br>iopl=0         nv up ei pl zr na po nc<span class="line"><!---->iopl=0         nv up ei pl zr na po nc<!----></span><br>cs=0033  ss=002b  ds=002b  es=002b  fs=0053  gs=002b             efl=00010246<span class="line"><!---->cs=0033  ss=002b  ds=002b  es=002b  fs=0053  gs=002b             efl=00010246<!----></span><br>libglesv2!rx::CopyNativeVertexData<unsigned char,1,1,0>+0x1b:<span class="line"><!---->libglesv2!rx::CopyNativeVertexData&lt;unsigned char,1,1,0&gt;+0x1b:<!----></span><br>00007ff9`73dc3dab 418a02          mov     al,byte ptr [r10] ds:000001f4`a5c50290=??<span class="line"><!---->00007ff9`73dc3dab 418a02          mov     al,byte ptr [r10] ds:000001f4`a5c50290=??<!----></span><br>0:000> kb<span class="line"><!---->0:000&gt; kb<!----></span><br> # RetAddr               : Args to Child                                                           : Call Site<span class="line"><!----> # RetAddr               : Args to Child                                                           : Call Site<!----></span><br>00 00007ff9`73f6fb93     : 000001f4`95d43e70 000000aa`b03fdec8 000001f4`95d43e30 00000000`00000000 : libglesv2!rx::CopyNativeVertexData<unsigned char,1,1,0>+0x1b [C:\b\s\w\ir\cache\builder\src\third_party\angle\src\libANGLE\renderer\copyvertex.inc.h @ 33] <span class="line"><!---->00 00007ff9`73f6fb93     : 000001f4`95d43e70 000000aa`b03fdec8 000001f4`95d43e30 00000000`00000000 : libglesv2!rx::CopyNativeVertexData&lt;unsigned char,1,1,0&gt;+0x1b [C:\b\s\w\ir\cache\builder\src\third_party\angle\src\libANGLE\renderer\copyvertex.inc.h @ 33] <!----></span><br>01 (Inline Function)     : --------`-------- --------`-------- --------`-------- --------`-------- : libglesv2!rx::`anonymous namespace'::StreamVertexData+0x8e [C:\b\s\w\ir\cache\builder\src\third_party\angle\src\libANGLE\renderer\vulkan\VertexArrayVk.cpp @ 107] <span class="line"><!---->01 (Inline Function)     : --------`-------- --------`-------- --------`-------- --------`-------- : libglesv2!rx::`anonymous namespace'::StreamVertexData+0x8e [C:\b\s\w\ir\cache\builder\src\third_party\angle\src\libANGLE\renderer\vulkan\VertexArrayVk.cpp @ 107] <!----></span><br>02 00007ff9`73f13a2c     : 00000000`00000000 000001f4`95dadb10 00000000`00000001 000001f4`95b73e00 : libglesv2!rx::VertexArrayVk::updateStreamedAttribs+0x4f3         by

        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1285885#c16">Comment 16<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Fri, Jan 14, 2022, 5:34 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1285885#c16">Comment 16<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Fri, Jan 14, 2022, 5:34 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>

        Ok, so I think I understand this a bit better now - thanks for the info and the fix Jamie.<span class="line"><!---->Ok, so I think I understand this a bit better now - thanks for the info and the fix Jamie.<!----></span><br><br>These crash would be acceptable in a non-WebGL context as it's undefined behavior, but in a WebGL context robust buffer access handling is required, and it is normally enabled - the Vulkan backend isn't even normally used by ANGLE (D3D on Windows or GL on Mac/Linux). However, it does get used for the SwiftShader fallback and then we're hitting this code path and then ANGLE isn't behaving correctly in a couple of spots where special handling is required and it would crash instead of doing what robust buffer access rules require (out-of-bound reads returning values from anywhere within the buffer object, or 0 or 1 etc). So the fix would be to follow those rules in the ANGLE Vulkan backend (when in the WebGL context), by making sure StreamVertexData calls only make reads within the buffer (however it is given a raw pointer so at least some of validation would have to happen at the call sites).<span class="line"><!---->These crash would be acceptable in a non-WebGL context as it's undefined behavior, but in a WebGL context robust buffer access handling is required, and it is normally enabled - the Vulkan backend isn't even normally used by ANGLE (D3D on Windows or GL on Mac/Linux). However, it does get used for the SwiftShader fallback and then we're hitting this code path and then ANGLE isn't behaving correctly in a couple of spots where special handling is required and it would crash instead of doing what robust buffer access rules require (out-of-bound reads returning values from anywhere within the buffer object, or 0 or 1 etc). So the fix would be to follow those rules in the ANGLE Vulkan backend (when in the WebGL context), by making sure StreamVertexData calls only make reads within the buffer (however it is given a raw pointer so at least some of validation would have to happen at the call sites).<!----></span><br><br>I reproduced this with an ANGLE end2end test by invoking calls similarly to what poc.html does.<span class="line"><!---->I reproduced this with an ANGLE end2end test by invoking calls similarly to what poc.html does.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1285885#c19">Comment 19<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Thu, Jan 20, 2022, 1:59 AM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        I think this issue is exploitable since the attacker has full control over the offset of the memory pointer. It would require some heap grooming for exploitation.<span class="line"><!---->I think this issue is exploitable since the attacker has full control over the offset of the memory pointer. It would require some heap grooming for exploitation.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        romanl: Uh oh! This issue still open and hasn't been updated in the last 15 days. This is a serious vulnerability, and we want to ensure that there's progress. Could you please leave an update with the current status and any potential blockers?<span class="line"><!---->romanl: Uh oh! This issue still open and hasn't been updated in the last 15 days. This is a serious vulnerability, and we want to ensure that there's progress. Could you please leave an update with the current status and any potential blockers?<!----></span><br><br>If you're not the right owner for this issue, could you please remove yourself as soon as possible or help us find the right one?<span class="line"><!---->If you're not the right owner for this issue, could you please remove yourself as soon as possible or help us find the right one?<!----></span><br><br>If the issue is fixed or you can't reproduce it, please close the bug. To disable nags, add the Disable-Nags label.<span class="line"><!---->Thanks for your time!         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>

        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1285885#c38">Comment 38<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>

        <chops-timestamp title="Thu, Feb 3, 2022, 8:36 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>

        Congratulations, the VRP Panel has decided to award you $7,000 for this report. This is a bit higher on average for a VRP reward for an OOB read; however, this was in memory access was in the GPU process, which we are wanting to incentivize the reporting of security bugs in, so this was judged under the criteria of baseline memory corruption in the GPU process and falls under the new reward amounts for GPU and other bugs in highly privileged processes (g.co/chrome/vrp). Thank you for your report and nice work!<span class="line"><!---->Congratulations, the VRP Panel has decided to award you $7,000 for this report. This is a bit higher on average for a VRP reward for an OOB read; however, this was in memory access was in the GPU process, which we are wanting to incentivize the reporting of security bugs in, so this was judged under the criteria of baseline memory corruption in the GPU process and falls under the new reward amounts for GPU and other bugs in highly privileged processes (g.co/chrome/vrp). Thank you for your report and nice work!<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>

        The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/angle/angle/+/ca32852e4f162ad41afc1df0e0efaeeb5f4e520f<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/angle/angle/+/ca32852e4f162ad41afc1df0e0efaeeb5f4e520f"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/angle/angle/+/ca32852e4f162ad41afc1df0e0efaeeb5f4e520f<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>ca32852e4f162ad41afc1df0e0efaeeb5f4e520f<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/ca32852e4f162ad41afc1df0e0efaeeb5f4e520f"><!---->ca32852e4f162ad41afc1df0e0efaeeb5f4e520f<!----></a><br>Author: Roman Lavrov <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Roman Lavrov &lt;<!----></span>romanl@google.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/romanl@google.com"><!---->romanl@google.com<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Tue Jan 18 20:05:55 2022<span class="line"><!---->Date: Tue Jan 18 20:05:55 2022<!----></span><br><br>M99: Vulkan: Prevent out of bounds read in divisor emulation path.<span class="line"><!---->M99: Vulkan: Prevent out of bounds read in divisor emulation path.<!----></span><br><br>Split the replicated part of StreamVertexData out to<span class="line"><!---->Split the replicated part of StreamVertexData out to<!----></span><br>StreamVertexDataWithDivisor, there is only a partial argument<span class="line"><!---->StreamVertexDataWithDivisor, there is only a partial argument<!----></span><br>overlap between the two.<span class="line"><!---->overlap between the two.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: chromium:1285885<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1285885"            issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
